abs: The Multipoint Expected Improvement criterion (or q-EI) has recently been stud-ied in batch-sequential Bayesian Optimization. This paper deals with the new way of computing q-EI, without using Monte-Carlo simulations, through a new closed-form formula. The latter allows a very fast computation of q-EI for reasonably low values of q (typically, less than 10). New parallel kriging-based optimization strategies, tested on a 6-dimensional toy example, show promising results.
title: Fast Computation of the Multi-Points Expected Improvement with Applications in Batch Selection
